meanings.definition: A substance produced by lymphocytes that affects other cells in the immune system.
meanings.sent1: The lymphokines helped the immune system fight off infections.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study lymphokines to understand how the immune system works.
meanings.sent3: The lymphokines threw a party for the immune cells to celebrate their victory.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness spread through the hospital like lymphokines through the body.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained lymphokines using a fun dance to represent their actions.

meanings.definition: Proteins secreted by lymphocytes that regulate immune responses.
meanings.sent1: The body needs lymphokines to keep the immune responses in balance.
meanings.sent2: Athletes require proper nutrition to produce enough lymphokines for their immune system.
meanings.sent3: The lymphokines organized a protest to demand better working conditions for immune cells.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like lymphokines, calming the tense immune responses in the room.
meanings.sent5: The scientist illustrated the function of lymphokines using a colorful diagram.
